Utterance: Hi! It’s great to see you again. How has your week been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! It’s been pretty good. I’ve been keeping up with my walks and practicing deep breathing.
That’s wonderful to hear! How has the deep breathing practice been for you?
It’s been really helpful. I set reminders on my phone, and it’s made a difference when I start to feel stressed.
I’m so glad to hear that! It sounds like you’re finding effective ways to manage your stress. Have there been any specific situations where you used deep breathing?
Yeah, I had a big assignment due, and I felt really overwhelmed. I took a few minutes to breathe, and it helped me focus.
That’s fantastic! It’s great that you’re applying those techniques in real situations. How did you feel after you completed the assignment?
I felt relieved! And I was proud of myself for not letting the stress take over.
That’s a significant accomplishment! It sounds like you’re developing a healthier relationship with stress. Have you noticed any changes in your overall mood?
Definitely! I feel more balanced and less anxious about school and work.
That’s excellent progress! You mentioned being interested in counseling techniques. Have you had any opportunities to explore that further?
I’ve been looking into workshops on counseling skills. I think it would be a good way to learn more.
That sounds like a great idea! Workshops can provide valuable hands-on experience. Have you found any specific workshops that interest you?
There’s one coming up on active listening and empathy. I think it would be really beneficial.
That sounds perfect for you! Would you like to set a goal to attend that workshop?
Yes, I’d love to! I’ll sign up for it this week.
Great! I can’t wait to hear about your experience. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I guess I’m still feeling a little uncertain about my future career path. I’m worried about making the wrong choice.
It’s completely normal to feel uncertain, especially when there are so many options. What specifically worries you about making the wrong choice?
I just don’t want to end up in a job I don’t enjoy or that doesn’t fulfill me.
That’s a valid concern. Have you thought about what fulfillment means to you in a career?
I think it means helping others and feeling like I’m making a difference.
That’s a meaningful definition! It might be helpful to reflect on the experiences you’ve had that brought you fulfillment. Can you think of any moments that stand out?
Volunteering at the community center has been fulfilling. I like seeing people improve and feel supported.
That’s a great insight! It sounds like working directly with people is important to you. How can you incorporate that into your future career decisions?
I guess I could focus on roles that involve direct support, like counseling or teaching.
That sounds like a solid plan! Exploring those areas further could help you feel more confident about your choices. Would you like to set a goal to research more about those roles this week?
Yes, I can do that. I’ll look into what qualifications I need and what the job market looks like.
That’s a proactive approach! I’m excited for you to explore these options. Is there anything else you want to cover today?
I think that’s all for now. Thank you for your help, Ellie!
You’re very welcome! I’m proud of the progress you’re making. Take care, and I look forward to our next session!
Bye, Ellie!
Goodbye!
